basics.name: Kishore Sampath
basics.label: Graduate Student Researcher
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: Khoury College of Computer Sciences, Northeastern University
summaryPoints: Researched and developed a multimodal, multi-label fair classifier for clinical decision-making tasks using EHR data.

Implemented a radiology report generation pipeline by integrating a custom Faster R-CNN object detection model with Mistral 7B Instruct, achieving 10% higher accuracy and 23% improved coherence over benchmarks.
Developed a novel multimodal architecture leveraging MedBERT to unify embeddings across 7 modalities, employing self-attention for cross-modal fusion to achieve an F1 score of 0.93.
Architected a heterogeneous bagging approach for bias mitigation across intersectional demographic groups, resulting in a 6% improvement in demographic parity while preserving model utility.

work.name: Khoury College of Computer Sciences, Northeastern University
work.position: Graduate Teaching Assistant | CS 5100 - Foundations of Artificial Intelligence
summaryPoints: Developed assignments focused on de-biasing techniques and building trustworthy DL models through adversarial training, explaining Black-box ML models through SHAP and Knowledge Distillation for Image classification.

Guided 500+ students through key concepts in Search & Constraint Satisfaction problems, Reinforcement Learning, Markov Decision Processes, Variational Autoencoders, Generative Adversarial Networks, and Transformers.

work.name: Indian Institute of Technology, Madras
summaryPoints: Developed and deployed an end-to-end NLP-based Customer Research Analysis tool with automated sentence tagging, reducing transcript processing time by 80%.
Designed a Context-aware Sentence Tagging module utilizing Zero-Shot Text classification with the BART Large MNLI model to accurately tag sentences based on user-defined keywords.
Conducted A/B testing to evaluate tagging strategies, achieving an 18% improvement in user satisfaction scores.
Built a data-driven application to optimize induction furnace operations using advanced analytics, collaborating with key stakeholders to ensure alignment with operational goals.

Developed an Insights module for exploratory data analysis based on a Tableau POC and an Analytics module for training machine learning models on furnace operational data, resulting in a 66% productivity gain for the client.

publications.name: Fairness at Every Intersection: Uncovering and Mitigating Intersectional Biases in Multimodal Clinical Predictions
publications.summary: This paper addresses the issue of intersectional biases in EHR-based clinical decision-making by examining how multiple demographic attributes interact to create disparate outcomes. The authors benchmark these biases on the MIMIC-Eye1 and MIMIC-IV ED datasets, leveraging pre-trained clinical LMs (MedBERT, Clinical BERT, Clinical BioBERT) to learn unified text representations from multimodal sources. Their proposed sub-group-specific mitigation approach demonstrates robustness across various datasets, subgroups, and embeddings, effectively tackling intersectional biases in complex EHR settings.

references.name: Aman Pandey - Undergrad Teammate
references.reference: Kishore is one of the most hard working people I know. I have witnessed his passion for data science and mathematics while working on a project with him. He is a person who strives for perfection and does any work however hard it may seem with great zeal and enthusiasm. I can without a doubt say that Kishore has the ability to transform any work environment he is in with his shear perseverance and the passion he carries for his work. - Excerpt from LinkedIn Recommendations

projects.name: Curriculum Compass: A RAG Chatbot for Personalized Course Guidance
summaryPoints: Engineered a Hybrid-RAG system utilizing dual retrieval strategies with cross-encoder re-ranking for retrieving course and review data, implementing query guard-rails to enhance accuracy and safety for course recommendations.

Supervised fine-tuned Qwen2.5 0.5B using QLoRA on 2.5K synthetic instructions generated via Llama3 7B, achieving notable improvements in n-gram evaluation and LLM-as-a-judge metrics, enhancing overall retrieval and generation.

Incorporated a multi-agentic workflow by combining query validation, intent analysis, dynamic retrieval, context analysis, and generation, leveraging advanced prompt-engineering and LLM feedback loops for optimized solutions.

Automated data, model training and drift detection pipelines with Apache Airflow on GCP through Cloud Composer and BigQuery. Implemented LLM tracing with Weights & Biases and data/model registry on Huggingface Hub.

projects.name: Multimodal Meme Classification with Enhanced CLIP}
summaryPoints: Architected a multi-modal classification system using CLIP with feature adapters and cosine classifiers, optimizing meme classification performance on the PrideMM dataset.

Implemented a novel Semantic-Aware initialization strategy to enhance embedding separation, achieving 76.06% and 80.27% accuracy, with AUC scores of 84.52% and 85.59% for humor and hate detection respectively.

projects.name: ML Olympiad - Autism Prediction Challenge
summaryPoints: Developed a high-performing two-level stacking ensemble classifier combining XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost, and Random Forest classifiers as base estimators with a final Logistic Regression model.

Resolved the unbalanced data problem using SMOTE and trained the model with stratified k-fold cross-validation, optimizing hyperparameters via a Bayesian tuning framework to achieve a test set AUC-ROC score of 0.943.

projects.name: Evolving Machine Unlearning: Benchmarking with Real-World Facial Datasets
summaryPoints: Benchmarked machine unlearning methods on the MUFAC dataset, by implementing Knowledge Distillation based SCRUB and NegGrad from scratch to achieve 88% retain set accuracy and reducing forget set accuracy to 66%.

Engineered comprehensive privacy evaluation framework incorporating three Membership Inference Attack approaches (LiRA, Loss-based, Classifier-based), achieving membership detection rates of 40.13% (LiRA).
